name: Rakshasa, Pustakam
description: The Rakshasa, known as Pustakam, is a small fiend with a humanoid appearance. It is known for its cunning and magical powers.
memorable: It can manipulate minds, charm opponents, and blend in as an ordinary object.
goals: To deceive, charm, and manipulate foes while inflicting psychic damage.
relations: May be encountered alongside other evil fiends or creatures that utilize charm abilities.
environment: Commonly found in urban areas where it can blend in with society.
strengths: Possesses limited magic immunity and can exploit charm effects to control enemies.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to piercing damage from magic weapons wielded by good creatures.
attacks: Can attack with claws for slashing and psychic damage; uses False Promises to charm opponents.
most_powerful_ability: False Promises, which inflicts psychic damage and charms the target.
senses: Has darkvision to see in dim light and telepathy to communicate with others.
additional_information: Can change shape into a Tiny object.
Advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.
Uses Charisma for spellcasting, affecting enchantment spells.
spellcasting: Can cast spells like Detect Thoughts, Mage Hand, and Minor Illusion at will, and Command and Suggestion three times per day.
test_queries: cunning monster that charms using promises
ambush predator that looks like an object
